author: Theo Dounas
title: dApps for Designers and Creatives
description: There are very few designers adopting blockchain into their work. How can we make Cardano the preferred choice for creatives?

assessments.note: This proposal is well within this challenge and it addresses popular and interesting topics within the crypto space as of today. Taking advantage of the current NFT and creative craze is a good way to bring in new users and contributors to the Cardano space. This proposal is well written and though out and addresses the challenge effectively. In terms of impact I give this proposal a (4). I would like the proposal to expand on how designers can use your tool in the future, the ease of use, and how you would market the tools you build. What is your plan to make the designer community well aware of your tools?
Bring in creatives to the ecosystem is a worthy goal. However how do they then sell these items? Does this need a marketplace?
The proposal seems well-reflected and has the potential to onboard a lot of value from artists and cater to art lovers on the Cardano network. It will provide a really usefull addition.

The proposal is providing a custom solution for minting NFTs for CAD designs and their incremental improvement in which the owner of the original design and the downstream contributor gets benefited. This a requirement that has the potential to bring a large number of designers to monetize their work.
Opening up more properties for use as NFTs and making it easier for creatives to use Cradano is a promising approach. The implementation with smart contracts seems to be a suitable approach.

The project intends to provide an NFT toolset for creatives. The tools in mind provide more evolved and nuanced NFT business models than what are widely utilized today. If the project is successfully implemented, I could see it drawing creatives into the Cardano ecosystem, and increasing the amount of NFT related transactions on the platform.

Onboarding artists and creatives early on to the Cardano blockchain could in time drive user-adoption to the ecosystem through the network effect that could be created. Exposure to the Cardano ecosystem and new users would come from the artist/creatives themselves, but more importantly from their fans and supporters that would be interested in interacting through their works. The volume of ADA involved in transaction could also greatly increase as the last few months have shown us that there's a strong appetite for NFTs.

The proposal provides a project plan with explanatory milestones and achievements. It also includes a budget that was revised from the comments and updated in order to make this proposal realistic to implement within the timeframe. Key metrics that strongly relates to the campaign are considered for the proposals success. The metrics are easily measured and evaluated in the future. All-in-all, this proposal gives off a very serious and solid impression. I think this proposal have a good chance of being implemented successfully if it were to be funded. I rate this proposal a (4) in terms of feasibility.

More details on how creatives will monetise their creations needs to be included. Without a market place why will individual buys get involved in these NFT's? Evidence to back up the experience of the proposers (linkedIn profile) would be useful.

The proposers are experienced in the relevant topics, so it seems. The github repository however is still empty, so a proof that they are up to cope with the work still is to be provided. The labor costs maybe are a bit high. assuming that three people work on the project and each of them works the days mentioned, that's a pay of 2500USD per person per month. Working on funds that also partially go into very charitable projects I'd maybe suggest you lower payment expectations a bit in order to enable more funds beeing spent on other items.

The proposers have claimed experiance as developers and pool operators. They will also be hiring developers for the development. The Git hub repository is almost blank and is not proving the capability of the team.

The level of detail of the proposal and the experience presented are convincing. The feedback to questions in the comments section also leaves no doubt about the professional suitability of the proposer.

The proposal lists two members with relevant expertise, but little verification is provided.  They do not list anyone with smart contract skills or propose how they will  achieve this important aspect of their development. On the positive side, the proposal is broken into many waypoints with clear goals, which should aid in the execution of the project.

The linked GitHub repository consists only of the proposed open-source license for now and no other reference material is provided to verify the credentials and experience of the team. The plan, metrics and budget are all well thought out but the chances of success for the project are very much in the hands of the developers and not enough information about their previous work is provided, particularly when it comes to artist management and curation. It's one thing to build the technical infrastructure but it's quite something else to onboard quality artists/creatives to it.

This proposal is loud and clear in terms of auditability when it comes to the roadmap and the time plan. It is easy to follow and understand your plan. You provide good key metrics that are easily compared. I believe this project would be implemented successfully if it were funded. My biggest concern about the proposal is how you will reach out to the creative community once you've built the tools. Great tools tend to spread by word-of-mouth but including a section about some kind of marketing plan or campaign would be a good addition to show that you have considered that subject.

A plan on what the creatives do with the minted NFTs. would be useful. THe plan seems to interchangably use smart contracts and NFT's. But what smart contracts? More detail on what the creatives would actually be making on the Cardano side.
A detailed schedule and success metrics were provided, this is exactly how you are supposed to plan a project. The plan overall has a quite professional appeal and presents an auditable project
The project has been clearly laid out with deliverables and measurable metrics. Detailed analysis is visible in the proposal. The progress is clearly measurable.

There are no metrics for measuring goal achievement. The metrics listed have no target value and no point in time at which this value must be achieved. There is a rough breakdown of costs, which should allow a small degree of auditing. The work packages listed are probably the most suitable for measuring the progress of the project.

The allocation of funds is broken down into a few categories but the largest, for actual development, is not further broken down.  The metrics of success provided rely on completion of the total project, which is supposed to take 10 months.  The attached google doc, however, does have "criteria for success" at each stage which should help with auditing the success of the program.

An overview breakdown of the budget is present, however I would suggest a more detailed explanation and a further breakdown to facilitate project auditability. As it stands almost the entirety of the budget is allocated to a single line, without further explanation given. There also seems to be an arithmetic error in the calculation of the total budget requested, as the sum of the broken down parts is 53000, yet 51000 is the requested sum. That represent less than 5% of the overall budget, so it shouldn't be a major issue.

solution: Build a Creative Engine for Cardano, by directly connecting design applications to Cardano
experience: @arlav is a designer/ architect, has built similar CAD tools to connect with Ethereum . Thomas is a Cardano pool operator & familiar w/ NFTs
